page.title: 13Language Helford Area.
page.content: In St Martin, Manaccan and Helford area many people speak with a Cornish accent. Those who have retired or holiday here bring other accents with them. The Cornish accent is not excessively broad now. Some dialect words are still in use. Croust_Snack at work often in fields Bucca_scarecrow. Lewth_sheltered spot Wisht_frail,unwell.Stank_hard walking Stagged_Up to your eyes. Eval_Long handled fork. Brer_Large or a lot. Hovest, Launder_ Guttering. Tifling_ Fluff on material. Linhay_ Lean to roof. Mowhay_ Rickyard. Maund _ Basket for wood or hay. Flasket _ Basket for clothes. Frail _ Light shopping basket. Whitnick _ Runt. Skud_ Scatter or spread eg Dung.
